text.p: Germany's Marc Goellner kept his country's Davis Cup hopes alive by partnering David Prinosil to a comprehensive doubles victory over Spaniards Alex Corretja and Carlos Costa on Saturday.
After losing both singles matches Germany looked set for an early exit from the tournament, but Goellner and Prinosil never looked in trouble in a 6-2 6-2 6-3 victory.
A straight-sets loser to Carlos Moya on Friday, Goellner recovered his serving form and was able to unnerve Costa, who was clearly out of sorts.
The Spaniard was broken in the opening games of both the first two sets, and again in the decisive fifth game of the final set.
Moya now faces Hendrik Dreekman and Goellner plays Alberto Costa in Sunday's decisive singles rubbers.
